headline: Easy Chicken and Corn Chowder
description: This chicken corn chowder is a hearty soup with a base of chicken stock and half-and-half with yellow and white corn, potatoes, and shredded chicken.
name: Easy Chicken and Corn Chowder
recipeIngredient: 2 cooked rotisserie chicken breast halves, shredded
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion, carrot, celery, and garlic in hot butter until slightly softened, about 2 minutes.

Stir flour into mixture to make a paste; cook until lightly browned and flour gives off a slightly toasted smell, about 5 minutes. Watch carefully as flour burns easily. Remove saucepan from heat and set aside to cool slightly.
Meanwhile, stir together potatoes, chicken, white and yellow corn, and 3 cups stock in a large soup pot over medium heat.
Whisk remaining 1 cup stock into vegetables and flour mixture until thoroughly combined. Stir mixture into the soup pot; bring to a simmer. Cook and stir until thick, about 5 minutes.
Stir half-and-half, nutmeg, salt, and black pepper into chowder. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Very Very Bland. Wasn't bad. Just tasted like chicken and corn inside broth
This recipe was fantastic! It is a keeper! I followed the recipe and made no changes. It was perfect just as is. I did think adding crisp bacon would be good. Maybe I will try that next time.
OK Allrecipes. This is my 3rd try to leave a review! This recipe was wonderful! I halved it since there are only two of us, and we garnished with some cheddar cheese. Great for a cold, snowy night.
instead of the half and half, I used carnation evaporated milk - something my mom used. And sauted the onions and celery first in a tablespoon of bacon fat. Other than that, this recipe is a go-to.
I had leftover chicken and corn on the cob from a bbq over the weekend. I found this recipe and was able to repurpose the leftovers, it was pretty good!

I used 1 can of creamed corn and 1 can of regular corn. I also used 1 pint of heavy cream instead of what the recipe called for. It came out creamy and delicious. This is a family favorite. I used a big pan to begin with. After I softened the vegetables, I whisked in the chicken broth and then all the other ingredients after it thickens. The process is easier this way

I made this recipe in the crock pot. It was AMAZING! I cooked my own chicken breasts spicing them with a little olive oil, Curry, and Paprika. I also added 1 Teaspoon of Curry to the recipe. Fantastic taste and portion size. Great for a family of 5-6.
Great base recipe, I also add bacon. Adds to the flavor, with a few some sweet potatoes and wild mushrooms. Again adds to the flavor. I saute the mushrooms with the onions.
It was okay but very bland and our family loves soup. Maybe some bacon,cheese,or bouillon
This recipe is delicious I’ve made it several times always comes out good. I like to add a little bit of fresh hot pepper. Enjoy

It’s pretty good - I always tinker a bit with amounts (I.e. - I had 5 potatoes so I just used them all.). My biggest revision to the recipe is to boil the potatoes on their own in the chicken stock for about 10 minutes, then add the rest. By doing this, it takes less time for them to soften after the half and half is added, which means less chance of the soup scorching.
Awesome. This is going to be a go-to recipe when the snow flies. It was, perhaps, a bit thick for me so next time it'll get another cup of chicken broth but otherwise mighty fine.
This was easily the best chicken corn chowder recipe I've tried! Make sure to stir fairly often when simmering for potatoes to soften. It gets thick and can burn.
Easy and delicious
Very good. I used 2 potatoes and added cayenne which gave it so good spice

This chowder is really great on its own. However, it’s really versatile too. I’ve made this soup several times and have never made it the same way twice. If you don’t have chicken, ham is a great substitute. Various fresh herbs are a great addition as well. Toppings like bacon or cheddar cheese are wonderful too.
So good! The only addition I made was to use 2 cups of frozen corn and a can of creamed corn. This soup is a favorite in our family!
The only change I made was instead of potatoes I used Gnocchi, the family loved it! Im going to use bacon also next time. TY!
I think this recipe is a great starting point. This was my first attempt at chowder. We liked it, but found it a little bland. Will definitely make again, just need to play around with spicing it up.
Very easy to follow, Can't wait to taste it. Its about 20minutes away to eat.
Just made this for the first time--my first soup of the season. I will be serving it with corn muffins. Excellent!

On a scale of easy, it was easy. I had double the corn ( 6 ears) so I used it all (6 cups) and increased broth by 50% and doubled celery, carrot and garlic. Only I didn’t have enough bullion so I threw the whole rotisserie chicken except breast meat in with the broth water and simmered that for 15 mins before taking out and adding corn, etc. The teenagers LOVED it, as in 2nds!

I tried to add more flavor after sampling because it was terribly bland. I added some chicken bullion and some bacon and it was still really bland. My kids voted no on me making it again and I ended up throwing the leftovers away.

Very good. I used whipping cream (didn’t have enough 1/2 & 1/2) and added a red bell pepper for color. I don’t think either of these either added much or high jacked the original recipe. I’ll fool around with seasoning a bit but it’s very good as written. I’ve reviewed the comments and may consider the bacon in the future. I’ve used that for clam chowder. I’ll definitely make this again.

OMG, this was fantastic. I ate it 5 days in a row, I know the potatoes do not freeze well and did not want it going to waste. I did not mind at all that I was eating the same thing day after day. The crispy bacon on top was perfectthe 1st day. Then I just added it to the rest. It added another flavor. I will deffinatly be making this again.

The pictures really don't do it justice! My family gobbled it up. I didn't "change" anything except using yellow potatoes instead of russet. But I would say that using fresh corn kernels is a must! You simply won't get that sweetness from the corn if you're using frozen or (shudder) canned.
Amazing soup did it up for sunday dinner and the family loved it and went back for seconds..
Very easy to make and delicious!

I added 1 more cup of chicken broth because I like my soup saucy and used 2 cups half & half and 1/2 cup milk. Just because I didn’t want to buy another carton. Next time I will definitely cook and salt the potatoes by themselves. Even on low heat the soup was sticking but the potatoes weren’t done. It’s very tasty
Soup is very easy to make turns out the licious every time what are the best recipes in the app?
The recipe was easy to make. Turned out great.
Excellent
Made this tonight. Turned out great . Just left out onion,celery, & carrot (my family doesn't like these)Added some green bell pepper for a little extra flavor

This is a wonderful recipe. So much flavor comes from really simple ingredients and just a few spices. Skip the other AR recipes that call for adding creamed corn and use this one.

I took advantage of the fact that fresh sweet corn is in season. I broiled several ears (and increased the overall recipe to accommodate), then cut off the kernels and used them that way. This adds just a bit of some nice, smokey flavor.
I added bacon and didn't add the chicken. It was wonderful.

Made this with a roasted chicken I had leftover from a bbq the night before. Made a chicken stock from the carcass then used the leftover mashed potatoes in place of the russets (saved me using the cornstarch mix) also used the chicken gravy from the cast pan drippings in place of the bouillon. Tastes great!
What do you do with leftover Rotisserie Chicken??? I will never have to ask that again. Terrific and easy to make. I use fresh corn for that added sweetness.
This was awesome and easy to make . I had frozen corn on the cob in the freezer and it worked well with it .

I followed the basics of this recipe with what I had on hand. When I freeze corn in the summer, I boil the stripped cobs in chicken stock to extract all the corn flavor and then freeze the broth for chowders such as this. So I used that; did not use the roux because I used just one can of creamed corn which thickened it nicely; added a small can of mild green chilis and a little ancho chili powder. Served w/ cornbread on the side.
Used cooked chicken, potatoes, celery, onions, carrots, peas and corn. Cajun seasoning, garlic, pepper, cumin, poultry seasoning., two cans of potato soup in place of the flour roux.
Great dish!
Added extra finely cut celery and shredded carrots. Half the flour. Whole family kept saying how much they loved it.
We absolutely loved this!! Very nice meal for a cold, rainy day! I served it with salad and sourdough garlic bread and it was terrific!!
Excellent cold weather dish.
I made this soup gluten free. I replaced regular flour with gluten free flour. I also replaced half and half with 1% milk. Soup was delicious!
Everyone loves this soup. But I don't use two pots. That's twice the clean up. Works just as well.
Added bacon. incredible !

Delicious! I did make a few alterations though. I used canned cream corn and regular canned corn. Added more onion, garlic, carrots, and celery than the recipe called for. Left out the chicken and added 8 oz of cream cheese. Otherwise, I followed the recipe and directions. Was a big hit.
This recipe was great, however I used 1 can of Southwest Corn with Poblano & Red Peppers (undrained) by DelMonte and added a tablespoon of light brown sugar. It was delicious!!
A very easy chowder recipe to make.It was very tasty too. I added bacon, cheese & oysters crackers for the toppers.
Too much garlic. Next time I'll leave it out.

I cooked my chicken breasts with carrots, celery, salt pepper and bay leaf, then used the broth from that for the chowder. It turned out amazing ! My whole family devoured! Served with salad and bread for a delicious dinner’

I followed this recipe with just a few differences. I cooked my chicken beforehand in Better than Bouillon and I also added a little cooked bacon during the cooking process. My family also adds more bacon and cheese when it’s served. This is our favorite chowder.
Love corn, this chowder is Devine! Made it just like the recipe & it was a hit. Thanks Merryb

Made this tonight...my wife has a new favorite! I added bacon to the recipe...rendered about 6 slices and then cooked the veggies in the drippings. Followed the recipe the rest of the way. It's not chowder if it doesn't have bacon!
I left out onions and added bacon

Followed the suggestion of adding bacon (I used 1/2 lb) and cooking the onions, celery, carrots in some (about 1/2 c) of the bacon grease. Drained off rest of grease and added about 1/4 c butter. Used matchstix carrots and diced them as a time saver. Also partially cooked the potatoes in the microwave before dicing. Used 1/2 (white and dark meat) of a rotisserie chicken. Did not add any flour - it was thick and meaty. Very tasty.

Excellent!!
It’s a keeper recipe!
Great recipe! Did not change anything.
Great recipe! Of course, I added lots of Tony’s and it was a big hit! ????
Very easy. Used creamed corn instead of kernels, as it was all I had. Overdid the nutmeg, but balanced it out with pepper, cayenne, and lemon juice.

This was a great recipe which I embellished with jalapeño peppers, red bell peppers, and bacon. I used cooked chicken breast from the freezer as well as sweet corn we had frozen from last summer. In addition, I used whole milk and added a bit more butter. Adding bacon gives this dish a well rounded, more flavorful end result, for sure. I will definitely make again. I made the entire dish in a pressure cooker (Instant Pot) making it very simple to clean up.

This soup was a huge hit in my house. My husband and young adult sons raved about it. I made a few slight modifications. I used evaporated milk instead of heavy cream. Because the finished soup seemed to need a some additional spice for flavor, I added roasted red pepper flakes. 

This is a soup I will make again!
I made as directed except I used skim milk instead of cream and I added diced red pepper to bring up the flavor! It was awesome! Thanks for the great recipe.
This was delicious, but next time I’ll cut the amount of flour by half. For me, it was too thick (although extra stock or water could thin it). Thanks for this...great winter soup!

Easy, tasty recipe! I was able to make it exactly as the recipe directed once, then needed to change it a bit as I didn't have enough 1/2 & 1/2 the second time I made it. I did add a bit more salt than was called for.

This soup was delicious! The only thing I change was I cooked my own chicken breast and after I made the paste I added the chicken broth to it along with the rest of the ingredients. Can’t wait to make it again!
Delicious! Needed more salt than usual. I also added a can of green Chiles!

I made this and it was amazing! I was complimented by every family member and will definitely make again but I did make quite a few changes since I didn't have all ingredients. I made this using leftover turkey from the holidays. Since I dodnt have chicken stock I boiled the skin and fat for 20 min in 6 cups of water and added onion powder ginger salt garlic a few shakes of each. I also threw in 2 tablespoons diced onions. Afte4 20 min removed skin and fat from broth about 4 cups left. I was short 1 potatoe and 1 cup of corn. To make up for it I added 2 extra carrots and 1 green pepper. at the end I realized I didn't have enough half n half so did 1 1/2 cups plus half cup skim milk and tablespoon of bacon bits. I followed the rest of the recipe except only other change was I blended 4 cups of finished soup until thick liquid and dumped back in just to thicken it up. Topped with green onions minced and shredded sharp cheddar salt n pepper. Its just perfect for cold winter day and my family just raved about it!
Made it as stated. Great flavor and a winner for the kids and the adults!
It was excellent! I used chicken thighs that I sauteed before shredding and adding to the soup. Other than that, I followed the recipe.

Holy crud that was flipping excellent! I sauteed a bunch of raw chicken breast instead of buying and deboning a couple of roasters. Other than that I followed the recipe to a tee and DE-FRICKIN-LICIOUS
i made this with only one change and that was gluten free all purpose baking flour. it was so yummy! would definitely make this again

I love chicken corn chowder!! It was delicious, however, I made some small changes. When cooking the celery, carrots and onions I used a small amount of butter and coconut oil. I also added turkey bacon at the end for more flavor. I omitted the nutmeg and implemented some paprika, celery salt and parsley. Fantastic meal that lasts for days!
We made this with leftover Cornish game hen & corn cut off the cob- delicious! The only deviations we made from the recipe was: used 1/2 cup less half & half and used only two potatoes.

Instant favorite!! My husband's reaction of "Mmm!" and going in for another taste test 100% confirms my opinion I will definitely add this to my meal rotation, especially when it starts getting colder. I made a couple of changes due to limitations of available groceries near me - i used 2 10 oz bags of frozen yellow corn instead of half white/half yellow, and i used milk instead of half and half and just added an extra 1/4 cup of sweet cream butter to make up for the creaminess of the half and half. I will definitely try adding bacon to it next time, as was recommended other reviews!

I modified this recipe slightly. 

First I made my own chicken I roasted 4 thighs and 2 breasts in the oven with olive oil, salt and pepper, Bell's seasoning, and herbs de Provence. 400 degrees for 30 minutes. I felt this extra step would help with how little seasoning was in the recipe. 

I also cooked my veggies a bit before adding the butter to the pan. I wanted them to be caramelize to for that extra flavor, and I seasoned them with Bell's and salt an pepper, again due to the lack of spicing. 

These are the only modifications I used and I think it turned out better than the original recipe would, but I liked this recipe because it was an easy jump off point to make my own thing.

I will definitely make this delicious soup again! My 4 y.o. daughter (who eats veggies like they're fruit) and I both loved it. I did use less half & half as others suggested doing (1 cup) and 1 1/2 c. 2% milk, diced up a zucchini from my garden and used 
 a large sweet potato instead of regular potatoes. The taste is still rich with less fat

This soup was fantastic. I sautéed the onions, celery, and carrots in the butter, then added flour. I also added ham later. Blended a quarter of the soup in a blender. Delicious. Will definitely make it again.

I had some smoked turkey left overs and broth I had cooked the smoked turkey carcass in that I used. Plus I had some turkey bacon that I need to use. It was delicious. I used about 3/4 cup smoked turkey broth and 3/4 of the meat was smoked turkey the rest regular turkey. I used 3 slices of turkey bacon and browned it in the pan before I added the butter with the first step of the method.

Love it! This is a go-to in the winter. My husband loves it and I usually have everything on hand. Easy and delicious!!
(buy a rotisserie and shred it , separate it into 2 bags, freeze, and you'll always have about 2 cups of shredded chicken on hand for soups or casseroles!)
it was really good!

This is a very tasty recipe and a new favorite! And with the new guidelines to avoid sugar instead of fat, I used the full amount of butter. I simplified it even further though. Instead of using another pot, I sauteed the onion, parsnip (instead of carrot, which my hubbie doesn't like), and celery in the soup pot and sprinkled the flour into that pot. When it was time, I added the other ingredients except for the chicken. Ten minutes before I expected the potatoes to be done, I added the shredded rotisserie chicken breast. Delish! 03/26/2017
Excellent!! Had a few changes - used chicken thighs that had been browned in cast iron skillet & then baked in oven, whole cream and some chili chipotle spice. Absolutely delicious dish!!
I added crisp bacon crumbled up at the end! Also I used skim milk instead of half & half and it turned out well! I used extra pepper and shallots! I will make this again.

Made it with following changes- tossed the vegetables in EVOO and flour- sauteed with 1/4 cup butter, then some white wine to simmer. Added stock, potatoes, seasoning to slow cooker at high for 3 hr. Added rest into slow cooker. 3 hr low temp, added milk with 2 TBSP corn starch.1+ hr then it is ready and tastes great. Shredded chicken on the side for those that want it (like me). Keeper dish for cold weather.
Amazing, especially on the weekend with you girlfriend and movie night !!!!!!
Made some volume changes allowing for greater yield. I also used smoked chicken and fresh corn.
This came out perfect. My teenagers loved it, pretty much no leftovers lol
I added 1/4 cup more of each corn, another half a bird chicken breast and one extra potato. Made for a meatier heartier meal.

Loved this chicken corn chowder. My husband who is usually supportive of new recipes said it was a keeper recipe. I actually used left over turkey instead of chicken, and made the bouillon with these leftovers. This made it more time consuming, but the flavors were great. Will definitely use this recipe in the future. May play with the recipe next time by adding thyme or other herb and or try bacon as was suggested in another review. May also try it in the slow cooker also. Thanks for the recipe.

I followed the other reviews and used the bacon grease to sauté my vegetables in. I also added in a jalepeno for some spice! Came out perfect! I suggest using rotisserie chicken breasts cuz they Have move flavor. Very filling soup! Can't eat it all the time but it's a nice soup to make in the winter for lunch or dinner!
Family loved it! I followed directions with addition of seasoning to taste with Lawry's season salt.

I used Yukon potatoes instead since that's what I had in my kitchen. Worked out great. I think I'll try to cook bacon and use the grease for the onions like another reviewer did then crumble the cooked bacon on top when it's done. Very good recipe
I added some finely chopped cooking ham to the vegetable saute and some finely chopped jalapeno. Very good today...tomorrow is always better after the flavors marry together overnight.

Loved it. Will make again. I used more onion, carrot and celery than called for . I like a nice thick sauce so I added more roux mixture at beginning. It's always easier to thin out than to thicken. I added mushrooms and an 8 oz. package of mild cheddar cheese to the chowdah. I used some thyme to it too. 
Oh, also topped off the bowl of chowdah with crispy bacon... yum. I like mine with a little spice, so I mixed in a teaspoon or so of Tony Chaachere's creole seasoning in mine. YUMMMM
I found this recipe to be over complicated, not easy, and taking way too long to make.

Made as is except, didn't have rotisserie chicken so poached some chicken breast in a well seasoned broth which made for wonderful chicken stock.. I added some bacon and decreased the butter.Delish ,a keeper for sure.
Easy to make and delicious flavor.
